members.prompt: What is the main difference between arrays and vectors?
members.optionA: Vectors have a fixed size, while arrays have dynamic size
members.optionB: Vectors can hold items of multiple types, while arrays cannot
members.optionC: Arrays can hold items of multiple types, while vectors cannot
members.solution: Arrays have a fixed size, while vectors have dynamic size

members.prompt: Which way to declare an array is CORRECT?
Which way to declare a vector is NOT CORRECT?

Given:

vector myVec = {1, 2, 3};

How do you add the element 5 to the end of myVec?

Given:

vector myVec = {1, 2, 3};

How do you remove the last element from myVec?
What makes a structure different from an array?
members.optionA: An array can change its size, while a structure cannot
members.optionB: The values of structure elements can change, while those of an array cannot
members.optionC: An array can hold elements of multiple types, while a structure cannot
members.solution: An array is a container whose elements are all the same type. A structure is a blueprint of a container whose instances can hold elements of different types

members.prompt: What is the difference between public and private variables and functions in a class?
members.optionA: Private variables cannot be changed, while public ones can
members.optionB: Public variables and functions are known to the user, while private variables are secret
members.optionC: Private variables can be accessed but not changed from outside the class, while public variables can be changed outside the class
members.solution: Private variables can only be accessed from inside the class, such as through a function. Public variables and functions can be accessed and changed from outside the class

members.prompt: When you declare a class or structure, you are creating a blueprint for a container that can hold a certain combination of elements. When you create an actual object from that blueprint, it is called a(n) _____ of that class or structure

members.optionB: function add(int a, int b) return a + b;
